Comment: Professor Uche is a great professor. All you have to do is show up, participate in the class, and submit your assignments. The class is easy and he is a chill guy and will provide any feedback if you have any questions. I'm personally not a fan of history but this his class was worth it.

Professor Uche was phenomenal. The assignments, quizzes and test were easy if you pay attention and listen to the lectures. His was of teaching is amazing you will not get bored. Thank you Professor for an amazing Fall semester. I highly recommend Professor Uche.
Super easy course. Make sure you are completing all assignments, and its an easy A. Textbook is needed however I think I couldve done the course without it. His grading is clear, and to the point.

Professor Uche, was an amazing professor. His teaching style was amazing, he made sure that we understood the assignment. His work is so easy. If you need help with anything he is more than welcome to help you. I would recommend everyone take this Professor. He is great! Professor Uche you rock! Wish I could take him again.

Professor U, designs the course and classwork for the success of every student. His knowledge of history is vast and he is passionate in his desire to see everyone of his students become professors themselves. His slides are comprehensive and include everything you'll need to pass his tests. Do your part, and you'll do well.

Attendance is very imortant, he actually teaches in his lectures and you learn. He is very easygoing but not a pushover. Please dont try to cheat lol. Ive seen it and its not a good idea, he makes the class understandable and is clear in his grading. Hes great.

Professor Ezeadichie understands what it takes to TEACH. It's not just about repeating information from a textbook, it's about understanding AND making sure the students understand. Ezeadichie, you the man.
Great professor. Do the work and you'll pass. Be prepared to talk in class.

By far the best professor I have ever took. He sums up eveything you need to learn and his lectures are very interesting. Hes very kind and passionate about what he does. He teaches u exactly whats going to be on the test which is why he let us out reallyyy early. Participation matters so raise your hand once and you have your Credit for that day

Hes definitely one of the good professors here. Theres weekly readings and response questions and we watched some videos on the library. Exams we did good review before and he was organized thank goodness. Im taking him for anthropology next.

absolutely great professor. come to class and do what he says and youll pass. also I recommend him incase you have to take his class only once a week. my set time was from 6:15-9 he lets us out at 7:30. he rocks

This is hands down the best Professor I've ever had. His way of teaching is easy and he gives great reviews before each exam. Exams are True or False. He gives extra for class participation, he explains the material perfectly, he doesn't sweat the small stuff and he only teaches you exactly what's on the exam. Do yourself a favor and take him.
when i say amazingggg.. he teaches you everything you need to know for his midterms and final; he's simply the best and you definitely will not regret taking his class.

Prof. Uche is the most sweetest ,respected,amazing professor they have in this college. I thought it would of been boring but he makes you understand literally everything. His personality is so amazing. Text book is required for his questions he give on chapters and he does videos. But honestly, I wish he teaches every subject because he so nice!
Great gpa booster plus hes not boring. Take his three hour class if you can because you get less hw and he lets you out early compared to a class that meets twice a week.

One of my fav professors! His class is so entertaining and hes a really easy going person. There are weekly assignment he will give you which is based on a textbook and its sooooo easy! TAKE HIMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!

Absolutely amazing professor. You need the textbook and you have to do the weekly readings and produce the weekly homework which is usually 2-3 questions about the reading. All exams are multiple choice and true/false. Pretty simple if you do the work. Even though I find History very boring, he never was. Class participation is a definite must!

Professor Uche is by far the best History lecturer I have ever had. He assigns easy homework with 3 questions every week. His lectures are so interesting and he is funny. He gives a midterm and a final. Take him and you will be forever grateful!

History is boring but this guy is so funny he makes it so easy and the work is kindergarten work! He assigns 3 questions every week and you print them and hand them in its so easy. At first he will call on u for participation credit but later on stops. Take his 3 hour class he lets u out in an hour and a half. You dont need the book just google it
He's great ! very funny, and gets to the point. if i had an opportunity, i would definitely take his class again. he's awesome.

AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING... This professor is very Fun and teaches you a lot. He makes sure EACH of his students understand the material. He is very straight forward so his exams and homework are VERY fair.  Excellent Professor!!

He's a great professor. He does give lots of reading and homework but he does take the time to go over every homework assignment and he does supply you with the notes necessary to study. His discussion of the material makes the class is interesting

At first he seems very strict but as you go on hes really funny and nice. He gives you easy questions for homework and usually wants you to say something per class (sometimes he wont call on people). He is not boring at all. I took his 3 hour class and he let people out in an hour and a half. One pf the best professors I have ever had. Good teacher

Say something once per class and you got your participation credit (don't worry his questions are easy and straightforward). His homework is so easy and he is very funny his class is not boring at all. If you can, TAKE HIS 3 HOUR CLASS! Less work compared to twice a week and he lets you out one hour early. Hes great at teaching. AWESOME GUY!

He is all about participation. When you participate once in class he will take your name and give you your participation credit. Homework is pretty easy and the textbooks aren't needed even though he makes you buy them. He is pretty funny and nice. Strict grading policy though. He collects homework. Participate once per class and give in hw timely.

You will read a lot. He uses powerpoints and emails them. His midterm and final are not very hard. He is pretty funny. I loved when he laughed at his own jokes. His accent can be a little hard to understand. Good man. Decent class.

Was able to understand with his accent. He uses power points which he emails to students.  Hw every week based on chapter usual 3-5 questions. On he's test his multiple choice is a-e and his finals has more short answer.

The best professor I've ever had in all my years of college. Very helpful and engaging; allows you to obtain a great understanding of history. If you complete the homework assignments on time, (which are only 2-3 questions per class), study for his midterm and final which come straight from the notes he gives you it is an easy A.  Also very funny!

He grades according to your effort on the work, and somehow he'll know that your forged or copied. Each class he'll ask you question about the homework you did due that day and you'd have to explain why you gave the answer. The tests aren't bad, you'd have to memorize some maps as a part of his tests. Very punctual and serious but not terrible
Had a blast last fall taking his class. He get straight to the point. Sticks to the syllabus and tests are based on what we have covered in class.
AMAZING,  WISH HE WAS MY PROF FOR EVERY CLASS !!

I took him for anthropology this semester at CCC and his class was very confusing to me. He wanted us to read chapters before we learned about them and graded us hard on them. His mid term and final exam were nothing like his reviews and he does not answer emails. He isn't a bad professor, but he could improve.

Dr. U is a great professor. Knows his work/history.  Must attend every class. Must do homework and participate in class.  Every homework must be typed & 1 page. Gives you enough time to study for your midterm & final. Reviews midterm & final.
Best history teacher hands down! As everyone stated before he makes it the so easy.
Great professor. Attend class, do your homework, participate in class discussions and you will be fine.
One of the best. Very great professor who has good knowledge of what he teaches. Focus on what he teaches and you'll get that 'A'.  Don't get 'the F'....as he says....lol

This professor is the BEST hands down! I took him for 101 and 200 and he is so easy and helpful... All you have to do is come to class answer the hw questions in class .. He clarity's the midterm and final he gives you everything you need to know to pass. He's funny and cool. If you want to get a good grade and be stress free take professor E!

One of the BEST.  You will never regret taking his class.  Look at the other reviews and you'll see.  It's impossible not to like him.  If you don't it's because you have a problem. Try him and you won't regret....easy "A" if you do your homework.

TAKE HIS CLASS! Class met once a week with a short paper due (2-4 questions)which he used to start the class discussion. He gave a midterm and a final both were easy cause it's the same questions he asked during the semester no surprises. He is super understanding and straight forward! You would only fail if you don't go to class, ever!
Professor`s name says it cleary "Eze does it" if yor are not interested in history find another class.
Very helpful and teaches very well .. Excellent professor !

He is a EXCELLENTprofessor. He gives 4 or 5 questions and u answer them from the book and he goes over them thoroughly in class. He respects your opinions participation is a must. He spoon feeds u the midterm and final. All u got to do is your homework come to class and you pass . I would definitely recommend you take him
great class he is an excellent professor
Very hard to fail this course. He spoon feeds the information.And your opinion is very crucial in his class, so express it!

An easy A. You get 4 questions per chapter, your answers being mostly opinion & you read your answers when he calls on u in class. He doesn't do traditional lectures, just lets u learn from hearing everyone's answers. Exams aren't cumulative, its only 4 questions from previous H.W.; Gives good reviews so you know what to study. He's very helpful.
He's a great professor. Just do your assignment and you will get your A!!!
He's great  i understood the course content he's a smart guy you really learn alont from him...and hes kind hot so that helped

He is a great professor, he makes history so interesting.He gives a short reading each class which you will have to answer questions.The book and classroom participation is a must.By the end of the semester you will be amazed at the knowledge you learn about the world.I loved his class so must I took him again for history 200:)
he was horrible as hell i dont understand how he got such good ratings unless he changed omg.
the best history teacher he explains and he actually teaches you instead of lecturing to you
GREAT instructor. One of the only professors I still speak to if I see him in the halls. Very nice and intelligent man.
He's an excellent professor and like to give extra credits.

he is the best
VERY INTELLIGENT AND HUMBLY MAN. I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR, SIMPLE.
you will never regret it. he is one of the best proffessors.Try him and you will never regret it.

love this professor his class was fun, interesting, informative, he is helpful, kind, kool, smart, reminds me of the fresh prince and the 80s best art professor ever would recommend him and would definitely take his class again young kool dude
Very understanding.
Easy class with minimal effort needed to get a good grade. Professor is lenient on grading, but can be slow to respond to emails. Unstuck ai was a helpful study tool alongside the free textbook.
HE DOESN'T RESPOND TO EMAILS. If you have any problems or concerns, HE WILL NOT RESPOND.
Very easy professor to work with. Gives you the material to study and work on and as long as you do it you're guaranteed a great grade. Gives lots of extra credit assignments. Would recommend.

Overall there were 3 assignments, each being simple and easy as well as having a long period of time to complete them. He is an extremely lenient grader and will probably pass you if you just send an email saying hello.
Easiest class ever

He's too nonchalant for me, Im sorry. Majority of students would love this, but he doesn't respond to emails, his syllabus hasnt been updated in years, and the assignments dont require you to buy a $300 textbook. This course was such a waste of time to me. I dont understand why every other professor could respond to emails, but he couldnt?

Very respectful, his only downfall is him not grading on time and answering emails on time as well otherwise he's fun and gives you time to make up work but don't take too long to do it because points would start deducting.

He's an okay  professor. Its up to you to learn the material. He reads from the slides only. He curve grades. From the first test I knew the type of professor he is. I put my feet to the pavement and did what I had to do . I would take him again .

Best Professor I have ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! sooooooooooooo good!!!!!!!!!!!

The best Nursing professor you'll ever come across. He knows his stuff. He has a great sense of humor, and teaches very well. You'll come out of his class having learned so much. You can't thank him enough.
Excellent professor! Take him if you want to learn. Come to class prepared and study all his lecture notes!!!

The best professor you'll find in the nursing department at MEC. He is very knowledgeable, and knows how to teach well.  We need more professors like him in the nursing dept. Professor Burke is an outstanding educator! Yes, its true do not take out your cellphone during class- it's only for your own learning experience! She is fair! You will get the grade if you do the work! And if your serious about learning she will work with you! She may be tough but she is a prime example of how to be a true professional!

I took her for the summer course. Man did we work, yet it was all worth it as I can still recall and incorporate the learning throughout my educational endeavors. She stands for you as long as you can stand for yourself. Integrity is important and honesty. Flying cannot happen unless you flap your wings.

She's not the nicest Professor but, she's sweet when she wants to be.  She's very knowledgeable though, just don't expect to coast by in her  class. Do your work! And show up! Also, if you're on your phone in her class your grade will suffer. She takes that super serious
Nice professor but please dont use cell phone while in her class. Expect to do lots of writing.

Enjoyed Professor Hernandez's course, his lectures are always interesting never boring, he's medium handy with the assigments , he's very understanding & cares for his students, overall I enjoyed his class alot.

I had Professor Cobb two semesters ago for diverse populations, I found Professor to be extremely proficient in social work. She has a great deal of experience, that she confidently shares as a tool to academically challenge and propel her students forward.
This professor wants her students to do well. If you do your part she will help you along the way.
Teaching technique is great. Ask you what you learnt at the end of each class. Easy midterm and finals. Exams covered what you learn in class and is exactly how she say it would be.
Amazing professor. Passion is shown through lectures. Pay attention and listen, you will surely get an A.
Dr. Roper helped me to understand music better than I ever had before. Her course exposed me to new styles of world music that I didn't know anything, almost anything, about. HIGHLY recommended!
Music is my first class for the day, and it's amazing how prof. Roper help me start my day with great energy and inspiration. i highly recommend her to anyone taking MUSIC 100.

Lovely professor. I have learned so much in this class, after having no intress at all in the history and study of music. She grades papers like an english professor but her tests are very well graded. Overall the class is an easy pass.

This professor is awesome I would recommend anyone to take her. She make you see music another way. Her class is very fun she made me want to learn about music and their culture. The text book is a must for this class. As long as you attend, participate, and do the homework you will be fine. Thank you professor you're the best.

My First morning class for the day and this professor makes music come alive.  She's very fun and lively her passion for music exudes from within.  Never a dull moment she is very clear and articulate her lessons very efficiently. She's very inspiring wish I had a professor like her for every class.
She's a great professor, she just amazing.  She makes you wonna learn and get bored. She's helpful when you need extra help. Very intelligent young lady.

Very nice prof, she teaches by slides which she also posts on BB, she reviews before quizzes and exams, her group projects gives an opportunity to improve a failing grade. she is easy to deal with incase of problems just go talk to her, she is very accommodating. teaches in a way that relates to real world, very interesting class. I loved her class

The tests are not what you expect. Make sure you study everything. The lectures are given via powerpoint, which range from 40 to 80 slides. She is an on-point grader but she will give you a change to bring up your grade towards the end of the semester. The group projects will be your soul reviver if you know you are not doing well in her class.

Prof. Williams is a great teacher. she gives lecture outlines and teaches by slide, which she posts on BB before had. she give exams outlines and still does a review, there is a group project but its really easy and she give 3 quizzes but drops the lowest grades. very informative class but very easy at the same time with extra credit too!!

very nice and helpful individual, she wants you to learn and understand the material so you can relate it in the real world not just to get an grade. lots of slides so you have to read to keep up. if you do your reading and don't wait until you have a exam coming you will be find
Assigns 5000 or more word reports on readings every 4 days And these readings are not easy to comprehend.  The workload is a lot. Would not recommend.

Wold not recommend if looking for an easy A.  Do not take if not good with writing long reports about reading assignments assigned.  Reports due every week with word count of 5000 words and he will let you know if the word count is wrong.  A lot of work, little time to do it!
RUNNNNNNNNNNNN...... NOW Dont do it 10 page paper EVERY WEEK!
Would not recommend for anyone to take! This class is all about writing. Assigns a 4000-5000 word report due every 4 days.  Take only if you can handle , enjoy and are good at writing.

Professor Chime takes a while to post assignments but most of his assignments are written and based on the readings. He gives you a good amount of time to submit the assignments online. For his midterm and final easy you basically choose 5 questions from the topics he assigned. There is a final paper where you discuss one topic. Is pretty smooth.

The professor knows what he is teaching. He is very specific on what will be on the midterm and final. I will suggest that you study because he is a tough grader. However, the class is great and not too bad at all.

i was very impressed with this professor. a lot of note taking midterm and final only and a project. Don't miss a class then you will miss out on good notes. Fair with grading . He monitors attendance. I would take him again. Professor Chime is very passionate on what he is teaching.

Professor Michael Chime is one of my favorite professors at the College of Staten Island. He is a straight foward professor. When the exams come he will mark the pages for you on what to study for. His exams are essays and you have a choice of what to select. His term paper project was very interesting on a subject that was covered from the class.

lots of assignments but gives time for submission (on blackboard) and they are often easy and simple. she is a really good professor, she makes the entire class interact and engage in discussions, she explains any and all questions clear, sometimes tests/quizzes are done online but they are mostly done in class.
very easy. You can't possible fail taking this professor. If you did, then it only explain that you didn't do any work.

she is great in what she do. she make the class interesting to learn. give pop quiz on the last chapter every week and it helps you to get a better grade.
discussion board assignments, a few quizzes, an essay. easy.
She's is awesome! She provides the most interesting and amazing lectures. She makes you work for your grade but offers support to all of her students. Teaching is her calling
Great Professor, awesome person, run for her class

Great professor I would highly recommend her - I took this class in the summer session, She gave a quiz every week, a final and she gave a group (cooking) project at the end of the semester. She made the class fun and engaging for everyone.

Prof. Sterling-Fox is a very knowledgeable, engaging, and an extremely nice professor. Kept the class interesting and fun, encouraged us to get to know each other. My favorite class so far. I would definitely recommend taking her class.

*Took her for ENG 360* Her attitude can be a problem, she's doesn't feel approachable, and her grading is inconsistent, but she's very knowledgeable. My biggest problem was the large amount of work and writing you have to do on top of you other courses (6 for me). It was a nightmarish experience. She's not for me and I'm not taking her again.

I truly enjoyed Prof. Hill's Eng. 112 class. All of the good things that you read about her are true. She is a true Gem at MEC!! I wish I could take every English course with her. I enjoyed her lectures the most, she really cares about her students. Do the work and you will be fine. Prof. Hill is highly recommended and will be missed.
She was a good professor, I will recommend her to anyone.

Professor Hill is one of the best teachers I have encountered. She is very understanding, she gives good feedback and she cares about her students a lot. She went the extra mile during the pandemic to make sure that her students did very well during our transition to distance learning. Take her class you won't regret it!!

I absolutely love her. She does assign the usual assignments such as reading responses, essays and etc. She gives amazing feedback and wants nothing but the best for you. She is one of the great professors in MEC.

Professor Hill is a really good professor who cares about her students passing her class and doing good in college. I think everyone should take this professor, do all your work and turn in on time and thats a easy A or B

Oof, Professor Hill is a real gem in Medgar, I swear you don't come across many professors that are passionate and willing to work things out with the student. Professor Hill is clear about her grading criteria and she is willing help if you ask her. She is also a hard grader and she expects the best from her students. She also uses polleverywhere so that we can answer questions from our phones.

Professor Hill was Awesome! Loved her Class, she gives you feed back on your writing and makes sure everyone is on the same page. Her teaching style is very clear and to the point, you wont regret taking her class.
This teacher work with students and push them to be better writers. she is an amazing person with her lectures

Professor Hill is an amazing teacher . She ensures that each student is on the same page. If a student is having difficulty understanding a task , she invites them to her office . Professor Hill is an awesome professor. She really makes you think outside the box. I really learned things about myself that I never knew from reading the material and listening to the professors lectures. Definitely would take a class with her again.

She is very understanding and allowed me to rewrite my papers in order to practice and improve my overall grade. I love the fact that she gives  a lot of extra credit and is very big on second chances. I am not sure what grade I will be receiving however she did help me improve my writing. She definitely earned my respect for being so helpful.
Loved the class.

Professor Kato is an amazing professor. She is super knowledgeable and helps make hard information easy to understand. Kato's class was great. She is very knowledgable about art topics and would often bring in her real world experiences to the discussions. The concepts can be tricky, which is why you should choose the homework option to get some more practice. Take copious notes in class because the final will ask very specific questions. Overall, she's great.
She's amazing and cheerful. I loved listening about her experiences around the world. Professor Kato can speak Japanese.

I enjoyed class and laid-back atmosphere. The professor is engaging and funny, often repeating what we read in the week. She allows late submissions without penalty!!! The coursework is well-distributed: Museum Paper (20%), Midterm (20%), Photos (15%), Art Project (15%), Homework (10%), and Final (20%). Overall, the class is chill and enjoyable.
She wants to see her students excel. Always a big help and responds to any questions you may have. I was nervous about taking an art online, but she made it doable!

I really enjoyed this class! her accent can be hard to understand but simply ask her questions during class or after for clarification. Weekly papers for each topic we go through but its not long, or hard papers. Simply pay attention to the lectures, and reread the materials on brightspace and write a paragraph or two. she gives extra credit!
Extremely patient

Her class is perfectly organized. I understood the material perfectly. Homework every week might be annoying but it helps you with the final. You reduce many points by missing 3 main assignments. Her 2 exams are fair-final exam is departmental.

Professor Kato is a good professor. She's helpful and fair. Will get 3 assignments, make sure you submit your assignments before the deadline, must do class participation and there's a homework every week. Be prepare to learn and meet new people.

The most professional professor I have had for the spring 2023 semester at CUNY MEC. She is clear and chunk information for students to understand. She understands that most of us are working while also completing our degrees, and assigns work accordingly. We cover all the important content without feeling stress or less than. Simply amazing.
Wow, Kato's passion for Art History is undeniable. She has taught for 10 years at Medgar and you can tell she genuinely cares about her students!! Never had an instructor like her.

Kato's pretty chill. Class's relaxed and you meet some cool people. I like her. Just have to write a few essays for class, but you get a lot of time. 2 big exams. She's available face to face for online class if you are confused, which is great. College emails don't work sometimes, delay, or disappear. IT office exists for the issues.

Great professor that really encourages, helps and is always there for the students. Her grading isnt that tough but she looks for certain criteria that you will know beforehand through the grading rubrics. Definitely put the extra effort in cause youll easily get an A in her class. Participate. Itll be mad awkward and quiet if no one does.

Took her this semester. Really nice teacher and relaxed. My online class had museum assignments and no weekly Zoom super easy! Would definitely take her again for another class. Just have to do a few essays and she tells you exactly how she wants it. Plus, a lot of time to do them and extra credit. Go to office hours. Overall, pretty nice teacher.

Kato is a great professor, who cares about her student's work. Her ability to coach a group of 30 students at once and individually on their creative ability is outstanding. She takes her student's work seriously and I would gladly accept any and all criticism she gives me, because I know it will be useful at some point in my professional career.

Best intro to art professor at Medgar!!! Graded off of 3 assignments, a final, midterm, group project, & some hw/participation. You have to prep a lot for the tests and she holds review sessions for each test that are so helpful (don't think any other art teachers do this supportive). So so helpful if confused. DEF take her!!!

She's really great, class is hardly difficult so long as you just keep up with the assignments. So happy with my grade! She's a talker, so try not to be afraid to say something too, she makes the class enjoyable and not boring.

Really truly cares about her students and their progression. Important to keep up with the writing, and be vigilant about your sources, but if you can cite and do research this class will be no problem.

Gets off track sometimes, your student skills are part of your grade, but she's a very nice person and class discussions can be interesting. Laid back with deadlines, very easy grader. Submit assignments and closely follow directions and you won't have any issues. No AI.
Fun and interesting class. It's "easy" if you take decent notes, show up and do what you're supposed to. Very nice lady!

Kato is a good prof. but sometimes assigns too much work. The work is easy, you just need to make sure you have time to do it. Her tests and essays are very easy. She was always there to help me if I needed help or had any questions. She's very nice, so take her!

Prof. Kato (as she's asked class to call her) really cares about her students. She'll extend due dates if you ask nicely! She's an easy grader, but is infamous for the amount of busy work she assigns. Thankfully, the assignments aren't too time consuming.she manages to make it bearable.

This was a great class, just don't get behind on the readings. 3 assigments, and 2 tests. All of which are given notice of lots of time ahead. I would say if you can take her, take her she is an awesome professor and it was always a fun class, even though sometimes you watch long videos.

-online class yet she's assigning things to be done In person. -she doesn't answer any of her emails until it's too late -UNORGANIZED. Prof Kato does her best to set students up for success in this class. She gives tips for studying for the exams and even tells the class what questions should be expected. She also gives more extra credit opportunities than any other professor I've had at Medgar so far. It can become a very difficult class to keep up with if you miss classes.
Read the syllabus. Work ahead. If you ask her for help, she'll give it but be sure to attend the classes too. It's a studio class and you really need to be in the workshops working when you can.

Professor Kato was an amazing teacher. She was extremely helpful and really cares about what she does. She is very accommodating and works with you. I got sick and she was very understanding and helpful. Her talks can be a little long but in the end they're very helpful and you get a clear understanding of what to do.
Good class. Projects are clear and interesting.

One of the best teachers I've ever had! I never thought I'd want to take more art classes after this one, but her class inspires me to do so. She always lets you know how you're doing whenever she sees you, giving really good feedback and advice to help you. Make sure you participate! She likes calling on people to answer questions!
Learning art history requires a hard work if you are new, lots of studying, but the instructor's lecture was very easy to understand, and she gave us extra credits to earn some extra points.

This professor is a lot better than some of the reviews state, I think that her lectures were very understandable. There's extra credit criteria for going to art live event hours, and the grading is based on rubric and your writing. Class has both lecture and studio work which is very helpful. Overall a very enjoyable class to go to.
The most caring professor ever- there's a lot of reading, but it leads to interesting discussions. Seriously loved her so much.

This class was so easy. I got the textbook but never even had to open it. We covered a module every week of class for 10 modules total over 15 weeks. The content was easy, we had videos, 2 chapter readings, one writing per module. Assignments worth more than homework, you could skip a writing but a missed assignment will cost a letter grade.

Writing heavy, tests are easy if you study as requested, art project you have to buy materials and present in-person, art reviews for extra credit, and a slide project. A lot of work if you wait until last moment, reading and writing but she has clear grading criteria, I got a B+ as a final grade, due to my own negligence on a test.

Textbook is included in course fee. Lots of reading, but material is pretty easy to understand. I received good feedback on my class writing assignments. Slide questions are from the textbook. One oral presentation about your art, which was pretty simple to throw together. I would definitely take this professor again.

I took Prof Kato for art history. She is an amazing professor! I needed this course as pre reqs for nursing, and it taught me so much! As long as you read the textbook and take good notes, you will get good grades. Make sure you study terms, images, and the questions well! I am so glad I took her :)

I had Professor Kato for art 100 and I loved this class as someone who is majoring in biology. Majority of the work was only graded on completion and on multiple occasions she would reopen assignments for those who missed the deadline. Very funny and makes strange topics interesting, quite possibly the best professor I have had so far.
Would not recommend. Didn't clearly explain the lectures and she critiqued your work incorrectly. She gave a lot of assignments with no help. She talks bad about your projects.

I took Katol's online class. Kato was so friendly and I often talked to her about my career aspirations and worries. She was always so supportive, grades generously, and is chill about deadlines. One of my favorite teachers ever. Would 100% recommend the class to anyone who likes visual art as this class helped me fall in love w it.

I learned so much more than I expected from this course and it was artistically satisfying. She supported each of us at our own level and her feedback was always supportive and helpful. Prof Kato is a really nice professor. Go to her office hour is helpful. Participation matters.
Kato is the best. She is determined, caring, passionate about her teaching, and takes her time to make sure everyone understands the material.

This professor is a personality. I thought that this was a reasonable class however I was deeply mistaken. She's not clear with instructions or due dates. her own art is the best part, but i made friends in this art class too and it was fun

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! I love Professor Nozomi; she is hands down my favorite professor. Definitely take her if you can. She is extremely caring and always makes sure to answer any questions you have. I had her for Art 108 and I was always excited to come to this class. Highly recommend!
Very kind professor and an advocate for all opinions and views when discussing topics.

If you put in the effort and time you'll do fine. She is very clear about what to expect on exams and gives ample time to prepare. Extra credits every week. Fun stuff
the art class was the best class I ever had in any school.Kato is great knows and makes great art. everything about art

Art history. You go to see art, write papers, and make art.

Professor Kato was a very inspiring Professor who care about all students. However, you need to do museum paper, PowerPoint presentation, and final creative project which you need to present in-person.

Prof Kato is awesome! She cares about her students and gets them involved in the lectures. She doesn't just teach at you. There is a textbook, but it isn't really necessary at all. fun! take her!!

The class only had 3 main assignments in total and 2 exams. No sloppy work is accepted but there is plenty of time. "Discussions" can be papers. Exams are also written essay exams. If you pay attention to her lectures you should be able to get all 100 points. Best professor ever. Very kind and understanding and truly cares!
Art history

If you have any interest in art take the art108 with Kato! She is awesome. it was a modest size lecture and studio class, and yet she taught mostly studio content based on a theme and knew almost all of students by first name. Her lectures and power points are also super clear.

I didn't get to bond too much with the professor since the class was asynchronous, but I enjoyed the class. Prepare to read a lot since there are chapter readings for the weekly homework. I loved this class. Professor Kato is very involved with student's progress. She was an amazing communicator, and the material was very interesting and thought-provoking.
Plan ahead, plan ahead for 3 assignments and the exams!

Professor Kato's class is rewarding. Detailed lectures, weekly writings, and departmental exams test your understanding. Stay on top of assignments and use her resources like unit slides to succeed. Overall, a great learning experience.

She is very unreasonable and doesn't listen to her students whether it's during class time or otherwise, if she asks the class a question and you answer she says your answer is incorrect just to say something specific that she never taught us. Kato is great. I took art before and completely failed. With Kato, I am doing great in the class. She is clear and understandable. She also has some great stories!

Love it!
Clear, intuitive professor. Kato makes learning art enjoyable, if not easy.

Prof Kato is a wonderful teacher. I got a little behind in her class due to an illness and she bent over backwards to help me catch up. If you work with her she'll work with you. Although I took her for world art her knowledge of nyc culture was very impressive.

I took an online class with Professor Kato. I was struggling with some stuff and didn't get to hand in all my assignments on time. Professor Kato always checked up on me and offered help in any way. Super kind, caring, and helpful. Just try your best and you'll do well in the class.
This prof makes lots of study materials online for free. Its amazing that you can use that much money for something else other than textbooks. Take her!!!!
Fun class with caring professor. You need to take notes and do reading
great professor even though she has a thick accent thats hard to understand at times

Professor Kato is amazing

This professor piqued my interest in art. Literally crystal clear.

Literally had everything laid out. Show up to class, go weekly workshops, do all required assignments and you're guaranteed to pass. Spent most of the class talking on the readings, with a midterm and final. Super helpful. TAKE HER!!

This class made my days and really was very interesting. The readings were easy to do because the professor made the class so entertaining. If you respect her, she will respect you. If you show up and put in the effort there is no way you can fail. She is truly an inspiration.

One of the most personable and helpful Professors I've ever had. Class was discussion-based and the Professor did a great job of moderating and making the readings relevant, clear, and interesting. Kato is an amazing professor. She's really funny and a good lecturer, the readings are interesting and she's a pretty easy grader if you're willing to make an effort. You should definitely take her.

Professor Kato is an amazing Professor , she always explains ideas clearly , and will make sure you understand them. She always makes time for her students if they had any questions. She is also really funny, and grades fairly.

Professor Chevalier was a very tough grader and a very tough professor. If you're up for the challenge I think you should definitely take her. If you're not, pick another professor.

She is a tough professor but cares about her students. She wants everyone to pass but isn't going to treat college students like babies. She makes it clear of what she wants done and expects it to be done, although she did give some extensions on papers. She pushed me and definitely made me a better writer.

She's a very sarcastic, tough-grader, makes-you-work-for-it type professor. Honestly, I can say I enjoyed her class because she pushed me and didn't baby me. This was my second semester back in college after a 5 year break and I received an A. If you want a challenge, she's your girl.

Victoria Chevalier is the most deceitful professor I've ever had.  She starts off all nice and interesting but she's really an eye roller & is very sarcastic.  If you're an A student expect B- in the class.  Her grading criteria is only given to you when she gives back the first paper.  She expects students to be writing on her level. Not fair.

Took this class during the summer, and she is a pretty fair grader. Basically you earn your grade. If you don't do the work she will not feel bad to fail you. Great at explaining, expects you to be in class on time, test were based on HW, try not to miss class, participation is important, she like good work ethics, and showing interest in ur grade.

she's so kind! idk what the negative replies are talking about bc i had her for CHML 201 (i couldn't change it on here) && her labs were super easy and straight to the point. for my class, she gave a 2-3 question quiz at the beginning of each lab and they were basically free grade boosts. that's how easy they were.

I wish I could have taken all of my science classes with Dr. Rajapakse. She showed honest concern for her students' success and her explanations of concepts were easy to understand. All that was needed to succeed in Dr. Rajapakse's course was a good attitude and willingness to seek help when confused.
This professor really caress about her students and she wants them to learn.

This Professor was a god send, as long as you are willing to do the work and show an effort in her class. She will give you her full effort. She was able to explain tough concepts in simple examples, I would 10/10 recommend.
I was pregnant while attending this course. She is great and take her students need into consideration. I would take her again!

Biochem is not an easy subject, but her lectures are very clear and I really enjoyed them. On the other hand, she doesn't make her own exams/ hw so they don't always reflect what was taught in class. She also wasn't very responsive to emails. Overall though, the lectures were very clear and she is a nice woman. If you work hard you will be ok.

She is a very nice lady, but seemed a bit overwhelmed as if she did not have time to correct PowerPoint typos (many errors completely changed my comprehension of topics), post full lectures (often only half a video posted hours before exams), or respond to emails requesting clarification/assistance. The course is difficult - she makes it harder.

DR Harsha is a great professor who has helped me grasp difficult concepts in biochemistry. If you are taking the MCAT her class is essential. I was accepted to medical school and she is part of my success as her class helped me with foundational concepts that were on the exam. She wants her students to succeed and is a true gem.

Dr. Harsha is no joke. (PRE-COVID REVIEW) She does not tolerate cheating and can be a harsh grader when it comes to lab reports. I would definitely take Dr. Sam for the lab as he is more chill when it comes to grading. The thing with this class is if you genuinely care and come to class, pay attention, and listen to her lecture you will do well.

She is a sweetheart but her online lectures were not helpful, most of the time her whiteboard is blocked by sunlight so you can't really see what she's writing. It was definitely hard to get a good grade in this class because it is all self-study. She is always available during her office hours to help you so make sure you utilize that time.

The subject is hard and Harsha understands that. She gave us many opportunities to redeem our grades. She also tries hard to cover topics on the MCAT. Definitely go to office hours, it helps a lot. The class was A LOT OF INFO so you will have to work for your grade. The work is 100% manageable, but definitely not an easy A. If needed, she curves!

Dont take this professor. She is nice till you get your grade. It is her way or the highway. She does not give students the time. You will never see her around. Tests don't come from material taught. Good luck
Stay away if you can. MEC has a lot better profs. You have been warned. Not worth. No good prof. Very hard and isn't available to help

Lots and lots of exams that do not come from her pp slides. She is difficult to reach via emails and when she responds she isnt clear. Stay away. Stay clear. Don't make the mistake. Good luck!

Professor Raj. became suspicious of the class midway through the semester and decided to make last minute changes to her syllabus without adequate notification which significantly lowered everyone's grade. Rude. Professor has no sence of teaching,Dont know how to speak proper English,dont have andy sence to convey knowlege to students,Uncoprative in pandamic.

Dr. Harsha can really teach. Although Biochemistry is a tough subject, she breaks down the concepts so it is easier to understand. You will have 4 quizzes among which she will drop the lowest score. Dr. Rajapakse really cares about her students. She wants you to learn and to pass. She is flexible with her office hours and assessments. She is also very knowledgeable on biochemistry. I learned a lot and loved going to Biochem lecture and lab. I highly recommend.

Helpful for the MCAT.

Shes really nice!! She is always willing to answer questions and if you put in the effort you will get an A. The grading criteria is:15% - quizes (1 is dropped so its 5% each), 30 percent for 2 tests, 15% - labs, 10% lab final, and 30% - final. She gives 2 extra points just for attendance and gave us more points for a extra credit trip. Take her!!

This class was overall pretty good. I just think that the professor should give partial credit for discussion boards, they are worth 100 points each & for full credit you have to reply to other students. She does not show up to her own office hours, never really answers her emails, does not grade all of your work. Wouldn't recommend her at all.

She's a NICE prof. Always willing to explain the topics and do not mind to explain it over again if u didn't understand it the first time. The good thing is that she gives out a lot of EXTRA CREDIT work which can help a lot if u r struggling with the assignments. Overall her class is not that hard. Take it u won't REGRET IT!!!

She's a great professor. Economics is not easy at all but she is willing to explain what you don't understand on details. There's about 3 exams for the breakdown of chapters. There's one midterm and one final. She gives out old midterms and final exams so you can be familiar on what to study. Extra credit is given out so freely that you will pass.

This professor knows that economic courses are not easy. She is not a push over but willing to help you whenever and to the fullest. Just go to the learning center, her tutoring sessions and possibly another professors. Buy the book or make copies of every chapter. Homework does help you and a little toward your grade. Don't miss class or sleep.m

She is really a nice professor, but if you don't understand something, before you take the midterm, you better make sure you understand. The Midterm and The Final is hard, if you don't study, you won't pass

This is why I don't judge professors. Professor Haggler was very patient. She graded very easy and gave a lot of opportunities to increase grades. This class was asynchronous. I can't say that I took much from it. Your papers must be written only on what she provides you which to me wasn't as much as you really need to make a clear point. She's very nice and give great feedback. No extra credit for this course.

I feel like she was a decent professor. But for this class, she assigned way too many papers. this was NOT a writing intensive course yet we had papers almost every other week. And for our final we had to write TWO essays. over all it was an easy class and she was okay, just hated the constant writing assignments!

Professor Haggler is such an amazing professor for history. This class only consist writing (which is not much) and sends videos or articles (both). if you have a low grade in one of the assignments dont be afraid to email her back if you want to redo. A lot of papers and essays! But shes very entertaining the class would go by so fast. Participation matters! She loves to hear from her students. Get ready to get 10-20 page papers

Professor Haggler is a great teacher. Her lectures are clear and informative. The writing assignments allow for student interpretation of historic facts presented. I highly recommend Prof. Haggler for those who need a Hist. 200 course.

Professor Haggler is probably my best teacher by far. She is really understanding and made our transition to distance learning a great one. There are a lot of writing but it's not difficult. She is a true gem of the school and I'll recommend her to anyone without even thinking twice.
love that she provided notes on blackboard and made sure to alert us during this covid peroid of where we stood and gave us time to accomplish the work, a real gem

She's ok. I think she doesn't grade fairly especially when i bust my behind to try to get a decent grade.

Dr. Haggler is truly a good professor. She knows how to teach history so that you will understand and she will answer any questions on the topics if you are not clear. A professor that cares. At one point in our class the majority screwed up on the midterm so she gave an extra credit assignment and and open book final. Shes very good. You wont regret it.

Dr. haggler is one of the best professor at Medgar, she is well connected with her lessons, and she love it when you participates and share about your own culture. she gives study guides and easy paper .. come to class ready to learn and complete all your paper, pass her test and you will have no problem passing.

Although she does alright with bringing life to her classroom while teaching, she seems to sound lost or not entirely prepared. Dr. Haggler is a great professor! I've learned so much about African American history thanks to her. Shes a good professor. Shes caring and she help you. She gives a study guide for the tests and quizzes. I love this professor she very good at teaching. Give you chances to pass in terms of extra credit. Make sure you have your textbook because you will need it to build up from the powerpoints she gives. As long as you do your work you should have no reason to fail

Dr. Haggler is the best at MEC. You can tell by how she speaks in lectures that she loves history and teaching. She made History fun to learn. Attendance and class participation is important. I took Professor Haggler for History 200 and 201.  She is an awesome Professor always willing to help her students.  She teaches well and  gives extra credit.  Professor Haggler is a great gem, she wants the best for her students.  This class was an easy A with work and participation.
Love this professor she gives you extra credit and you come to class and you do all  her work pass her exams and pass the finial you pass the class

She facilitates and allows students to share opinions on topics and is very big on class participation. She doesn't make the course harder than it should be just hand in your assignment on time. It does help that she has a very good sense of humor so the class environment is not boring.

Participate, pass exams and go to class. Easy A. Love professor Haggler,,

When i heard stastics i said aw man here we go cause i took algebra 4 times lol and i knew it was gonna be a hassle . I learned that it depends on the professor. This man was very sarcastic , funny . 5 questions on the midterm, 5 questions on the final . Show up on bb And youll be fine.

professor martin is one of the best math teacher i've had experience with at  MEC, he explains everything clearly for you to understand. i recommend him any day to anyone

Professor Allan is very communicative and approachable professor. Made my very first semester less stressful. On the top of everything good, professor gives exact instructions and lectures presented on his way are easy to understand.

very understandable, wants you to pass the class and will help, class work will make you want to engage.
